1.long: up, above, up to the top, up to the brim, things above, heaven, the heavenly region.

where, whither, when, in what place.

4.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.

5.long: lit. and met: I put to death, make as dead; I render weak, impotent.

7.long: I walk, hence Hebraistically (in an ethical sense): I conduct my life, live.
at one time or other, at some time, formerly.

8.long: adv. (a) of time: just now, even now; just at hand, immediately, (b) of logical connection: now then, (c) in commands and appeals: at this instant.

8.brief: but, on the other hand, and
8.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

8.long: I lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put.

11.long: a Hellene, the native word for a Greek; it is, however, a term wide enough to include all Greek-speaking (i.e. educated) non-Jews.
(a technical word of Jewish use) foreskin, prepuce: used sometimes as a slang term by Jews, of Gentiles.

11.brief: a foreigner who speaks neither Greek nor Latin
11.long: a foreigner, one who speaks neither Greek nor Latin; as adj: foreign.
a Scythian, as typical of the uncivilized.

chosen out, elect, choice, select, sometimes as subst: of those chosen out by God for the rendering of special service to Him (of the Hebrew race, particular Hebrews, the Messiah, and the Christians).
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
I love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem.
the inward parts; the heart, affections, seat of the feelings.

24.long: that, since, because; may introduce direct discourse.

an inheritance, an heritage, regularly the gift of God to His chosen people, in the Old Testament: the Promised Land, in NT a possession viewed in one sense as present, in another as future; a share, participation.

24.long: I am a slave, am subject to, obey, am devoted.

25.long: I act unjustly towards, injure, harm.
